name: Animated Armor
lore: Animated objects are magically imbued with a semblance of life. They follow the orders of their creators, attacking intruders or performing simple tasks. When their creator dies, or when their instructions run out, they may continue to carry out the last command given. Animated armor is a hollow suit of armor that moves under its own power, clanking along corridors and standing guard over vaults and doorways.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.description: The armor has the Incapacitated condition while in the area of an Antimagic Field spell. If targeted by Dispel Magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or have the Unconscious condition for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: If the armor is motionless at the start of combat, it has Advantage on its Initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the armor move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the armor is animate.

multiattack.description: The armor makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.
